name: White Plains
tagline: Westchester's urban hub — walkability, transit access, and diverse housing
overview:
White Plains is Westchester County's economic and governmental center — a genuine city of 60,000 that offers urban amenities in a suburban county setting. For buyers and renters seeking walkability, transit convenience, and housing at more accessible price points, White Plains is often the best answer in Westchester.

Downtown White Plains has been transformed over the past decade into a legitimate dining and entertainment destination. The Renaissance Square entertainment complex, the Westchester Mall, and hundreds of restaurants make White Plains a place where people choose to spend their evenings and weekends, not just their commutes.

The Metro-North Harlem Line stops at White Plains station, one of the busiest in Westchester, providing service to Grand Central Terminal in approximately 40 minutes. Numerous bus routes provide local transit connectivity.

Housing ranges from luxury high-rise condos in the downtown core to single-family neighborhoods in the northern and southern sections of the city. Price points vary enormously — from under $300,000 for a studio condo to over $1 million for a larger single-family home in the top school zone areas.

transit: Harlem Line — 40 min to Grand Central

seo.title: White Plains NY Real Estate — Homes & Condos for Sale
seo.description: White Plains NY — urban convenience meets Westchester living. Browse homes and condos with local expert Alexandra Reeves.
